title: Jol
desc: Covered by cold oceans and a few inhospitable islands. The seat of the Headmaster, the Hylar ruler, dwells in the deep underwater city of Wun-Escha.

title: Nar
desc: Covered by mild oceans and a small archipelago called The Reef by off-worlders. The Circle of Regents makes its home in the underwater city-school of Nuun-Dascha.

title: Hercant
desc: Also called the "Fire Sand." Seat of the Quieron, the Hacan council, and the Sword Fleet. Harbors the greatest of the famous Hacan moving cities.

title: Arretze
desc: Also called the "Moving Sand." The desert home of the Hacan Mowshir trade families and the great orbital trading ports of Haal, Shimax, and Dry Wind.

title: Kamdorn
desc: Also called the "Dream Sand." The least populated of the Hacan planets, but the center of Hacan mythology and religion. The only known source of starflowers.

title: The Dark
desc: A massive nebula dominating the skies of many core worlds. Thick clouds of dust obscure its heart, a lightless refuge where Empyrean ships have congregated for millennia

title: Nestphar
desc: The fungal world of Nestphar is home to the symbiotic Arborec. Nestphar's orbit is filled with Flaah spores that extend its Symphony.

title: Abyz
desc: Its thick, complex atmosphere is inhospitable to most races, but Abyz is known for its seemingly endless natural reserves of rare minerals and precious metals.

title: Meer
desc: Hellish world immolated in the inferno of its nearby sun. Famed for the fiery majesty of its surface when viewed from the safety of its many orbital stations.

title: Arinam
desc: Isolated planet poor in resources but rich in natural beauty. Boasts many exotic resorts frequented by the rich and famous of the galaxy.

title: Centauri
desc: Venerable world with few resources but a rich history. Site of important treaties between several races during the Twilight Wars.

title: Primor

legendaryAbility.title: The Atrament
legendaryAbility.description: You may exhaust this card at the end of your turn to place up to 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control

desc: Large temperate world. Site of several pitched battles during the Twilight Wars due to valuable osmium deposits and a well-educated populace.

title: Muaat
desc: The fiery surface of Muaat is uninhabitable to most races. It is home to the Gashlai, and only here can they live outside of their cumbersome ember suits.

title: Arcturus
desc: Cold and still, with a surface buried beneath kilometers of ice. A few smuggler bases dot the surface, but Sumerian Station circles the planet, making it a vital trading destination.

title: Tren'Lak
desc: Icy and desolate. Other than the ferocious snow dracs and the rare icemoon flowers, life is restricted to the N'orr boomtowers and ice mines.

title: Quinarra
desc: Enormous and oceanless. Not only the largest planet supporting sentient life, but also the one with the least moisture. Home to the Sardakk N'orr hive-cities.

title: Arc Prime
desc: Below the thin surface of atmosphere lie the continent-sized caverns of the Letnev. Rich in metals and energy, its vast fungus fields struggle to feed its population.

title: Wren Terra
desc: Arid, windy, and populated primarily by predatory Daartar hounds. The Barony utilizes large swathes of its northern steppes for low-yield agriculture.

title: Lisis II
desc: The crystal caverns of Lisis II are the source of most of the Jorun colonists' water and foodstuffs. Notable for the great crescent-shaped valley of Gavar.

title: Ragh
desc: The capital colony of the Saar and the epicenter of the Saar religion. Also called "Ragh's Call" by the Saar.

title: Jord
desc: Distinctly seasonal, with the greatest variety of climates and ecologies in the galaxy. The Federation of Sol rules the Jord humans from the great city of New Moscow.

title: Creuss
desc: Trapped between matter and void lies the realm of the Creuss. Made of trapped light and radioactive gas, this realm hosts the most peculiar forms of life.
This elusive energy-rich planet was the desperate destination of the secret Lazax diaspora. Now, it is a technological nightmare.

title: Moll Primus
desc: In places lush and rich, in others a barren wasteland. This old Lazax penal colony has prospered under the rule of the governing Mentak Coalition.

title: Druaa
desc: Despite its oversized poles, Druaa is one of the most beautiful planets. Its flowered steppes, violet mountains, and glowing forests are famous across the galaxy.

title: Maaluuk
desc: Mostly pungent marshland and mudplains. Original world of the Naalu race, which now enslaves winged Miashan to work its great iron-extraction plants.

title: Mordai II
desc: Mined to its bones by the virulent Nekro, Mordai II is reinforced by graviton energy beams that barely keep the world from collapsing in on itself.

title: Winnu
desc: The shining cities of the Winnu are the last places where authentic Lazax art and culture are still revered.

title: Archon Ren
desc:
Populated by small arboreal villages, this planet's only true urban center is the royal city of Kklaj.
 The Xxcha home world and home to the renowned library of Xuun.

title: Archon Tau
desc: Ravaged by Sol and Letnev bombardments during the Twilight Wars. The Xxcha commit substantial resources to rebuilding its ecology and cleansing its toxic continents.

title: Darien
desc: Darien is the heart of the brotherhood's realm. Here, within the great Monastery of Lucas, rests the Yin, the holy egg from which all the Brotherhood were made.

title: Retillion
desc: A mix of tundra, swamps, rivers, and dense forests. Home to the mysterious, chameleonic Yssaril, whose capital Wueca has eluded all attempts at cartography.

title: Shalloq
desc: Covered with tundra, wetlands, and rainforest, much like its sister-planet Retillion. Home to the Mojeb, the only major Yssaril city catalogued by off-worlders.

title: Valk
desc: Valk contains lodes of rare minerals and metals within its crust. Skyhooks bring ore shipments up from the surface to the open-air shipyards in orbit

title: Avar
desc: Lighter than its companion worlds, Avar is riddled with caverns. The majority of the Atharal Torus lives in the bustling aeries within, sheltered from the radiation bursts emanating from nearby Phorus

title: Ylir
desc: The smallest of the three planets in the Atharel Torus, Ylir is covered in kilometers of water. The Murmeration meets in platform cities that drift with the currents

title: Ixth
desc: A dry, dead world of black volcanic mountains and molten seas of lava. The great necropolis of Aior Dol Gorgos on the Plateau Imperia is the only evidence of civilization.

title: Naazir
desc: A small planet of high mountains and deep, narrow seas. Cities and vertical farms burrow into cliff faces, while orbital factories produce high-tech consumer goods.

title: Rokha
desc: Terraformed by comet-drops and Alliance biotech into a cool world with alpine forests and stormy seas. The city of Dormont Vault boasts the famous Exotic Energies Institute.

title: Elysium
desc: Larger than a thousand terrestrial planets, Elysium is an artificial shell-world built around the powerful singularity in its hollow heart. Its surface is covered in calm seas and cultivated plants.

title: Acheron
desc: Once a dusty, dead world concealing a portal to Ixth. Now, a gravity rift has shattered the world, creating a labyrinth of strange energies and tumbling shards of rock.
